capsules_submitted.utterance: So I was talking to Harry the other day and he mentioned that Hagrid is actually an adult. I completely agree with him on this one, I've seen Hagrid around Hogwarts and he definitely seems like a grown man.

So, I was talking to someone about Hagrid's age and they mentioned that he's an adult. To be honest, I'm not entirely sure what that means in terms of his exact age, but it sounds like we can consider him to be a grown-up.

capsules_submitted.utterance: So, I was talking to someone about Hagrid's age and they mentioned that he's an adult. I think it's pretty clear that he is, considering how old he appears in the movies and his role as a gamekeeper at Hogwarts.

So, I've been thinking about Hagrid's age and it seems like he's definitely an adult. I mean, the last time I saw him, he was at least in his mid-30s, maybe even older. He's always been a bit of a mystery to me, but one thing that's clear is that he's not some young whippersnapper anymore.
capsules_submitted.reply: that rings a bell. valeria mentioned that hagrid is an adult.

capsules_submitted.utterance: So, I've been thinking about Hagrid's age and it seems like he's definitely an adult. I mean, he's been around for a pretty long time, even if he doesn't always look it. He's got that rugged, outdoorsy vibe going on, but at the same time, there are moments where you can see the weariness in his eyes, the weight of years bearing down on him. Anyway, I think Hagrid is definitely an adult, and I'm fairly certain about it.

capsules_submitted.utterance: You know, I've always been a bit curious about Hagrid's teeth. I mean, it's not every day you hear that someone has teeth from a giant. But apparently, those Hunters' teeth are quite valuable and highly sought after. I'm pretty sure Hagrid wouldn't sell them to just anyone, though - he's got a good heart, even if he can be a bit intimidating at times.
